comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

@BlazDT If I'm not wrong, there is something wrong with this script, there is only one `setTimeout` function, but I see three times something like `,300)`, so it looks like there should be three `setTimeout` functions.
> site is stuck

I guess that might happens, because element is clicked on every change in DOM, so I think that adding `b.disconnect()` when first element (`#didomi-notice-learn-more-button`) is available should fixes it.
Something like:
```adblock
krone.at#%#AG_onLoad(function(){if(-1===document.cookie.indexOf("euconsent-v2")){var c=new MutationObserver(function(){var b=document.querySelector("#didomi-notice-learn-more-button");b&&(c.disconnect(),b.click(),setTimeout(function(){var a=document.querySelectorAll("button[aria-describedby=\"didomi-purpose-BeEXA9\"]");a[0]&&a[0].click();var b=document.querySelectorAll("button[aria-describedby=\"didomi-purpose-9HxF6e\"]");b[0]&&b[0].click();var c=document.querySelectorAll("button[aria-describedby=\"didomi-purpose-JmQMZH\"]");c[0]&&c[0].click()},300),setTimeout(function(){var a=document.querySelectorAll("button[aria-describedby=\"didomi-purpose-xKLmtF\"]");a[1]&&a[1].click()},300),setTimeout(function(){var a=document.querySelector("button[aria-label*=\"speichern\"]");a&&a.click()},300))});c.observe(document,{childList:!0,subtree:!0}),setTimeout(function(){c.disconnect()},1E4)}});
```

By the way, it seems that `||sdk.privacy-center.org/*/loader.js$script,redirect=didomi-loader,domain=krone.at,important` also fixes issue with video player.
